Heading: Product
Note: The title element refers to an individual product

Heading: Collection level
Note: The title element refers to the top level of a bibliographic collection

Heading: Subcollection
Note: The title element refers to an intermediate level of a bibliographic collection that comprises two or more ‘sub-collections’

Heading: Content item
Note: The title element refers to a content item within a product, eg a work included in a combined or ‘omnibus’ edition, or a chapter in a book. Generally used only for titles within <ContentItem> (Block 3)

Heading: Master brand
Note: The title element names a master brand where the use of the brand spans multiple collections and product forms, and possibly multiple imprints and publishers. Used only for branded media properties carrying, for example, a children’s character brand

Heading: Sub-subcollection
Note: The title element refers to an intermediate level of a bibliographic collection that is a subdivision of a sub-collection (a third level of collective identity)
